classes.description: Base parent banner class. This defaults to the system banner style.
Adds the higher importance style by emboldening the background color. These should only be used for pressing information that needs to be noticed by the user.
Pins the banner to the top of the window and pushes all app content down.

accessible.description: Provides the user with important, and usually time-sensitive information, often telling the user an element has been updated. (Source)

Informs assistive technologies, such as screen readers, if they should ignore the element. This should not be confused with the HTML hidden attribute which tells the browser to not display an element. (Source)
Dialog which contains the alert message and where the initial focus goes to in an element within a dialog. (Source)
Only used if a title is present, it provides assistive technologies with a title for the dialog. (Source)
If aria-labelledby is not used (because no title is present), this must be used to provides assistive technologies with a title for the dialog. (Source)
Provides assistive technologies with the alert's descriptive copy. (Source)
